title: About
text: This website is a work in progress to document my CANDO+P analysis work.

title: March 13 2023
text:
Code
options(scipen = 0, digits = 2)
library(here)

# functions
source(here("scripts", "cycle_parsing.R"))
source(here("scripts", "pull_solids.R"))
source(here("scripts", "plotting.R"))
source(here("scripts", "max_rates.R"))

# packages
library(MetBrewer)
library(ggplot2)
library(readxl)
library(lubridate)
library(reshape2)
library(dplyr)

# data
file_path <- "C:/Users/mckyf/Northwestern University/Wells Research Group - CANDO+P Reactor/04 Performance data/"
excel_cycle <- "cycle_results_2023.xlsx"
excel_solids <- "daily_weekly_measurements.xlsx"

### choose date ###
choose_date <- "2023-03-13" # change this date

df <- cycle_parse(file.path(file_path, excel_cycle), choose_date)
solids <- get_recent_tss(file.path(file_path, excel_solids), choose_date)

title: March 13 2023
text:
P release rate
Based on the in-cycle plot, I will use the first 3 timepoints for this calculation.


Code
ana_phos_rate <- get_max_rate(df, "ana", "phosphate", 3, solids)


The maximum phosphate release rate is 32.83 mgP/gTSS/hour.

title: March 13 2023
text:
Denitrification rate & anoxic P uptake
Based on the in-cycle plot, I will use the first 3 timepoints for this calculation.


Code
# rates normalized to biomass
anx_denit_rate <- get_max_rate(df, "anx", "nitrite", 3, solids)
anx_phos_rate <- get_max_rate(df, "anx", "phosphate", 3, solids)


The maximum denitrification rate is 5.67 mgN/gTSS/hour.
The maximum anoxic phosphorus uptake rate is 3.83 mgP/gTSS/hour.


Code
rates_df <- tibble(rates = c("phos_rel", "phos_up", "nit_denit"),
                   values = c(ana_phos_rate, anx_phos_rate, anx_denit_rate),
                   date = choose_date)

saveRDS(rates_df, file = here("data", paste0("rates-", choose_date, ".RDS")))

title: March 30 2023 glycogen test
text: This week I tested the glycogen extraction and measurement with some in-cycle samples. Samples for glycogen analysis were collected during the anaerobic and anoxic phases of the reactor cycle. A rough draft of the protocol used for the glycogen extraction and measurement can be found here.

title: March 30 2023 glycogen test
text:
Notebook set up


Code
options(scipen = 0, digits = 2)
library(here)

# functions
# functions
source(here("scripts", "cycle_parsing.R"))
source(here("scripts", "pull_solids.R"))
source(here("scripts", "plotting.R"))
source(here("scripts", "max_rates.R"))

# packages
library(MetBrewer)
library(ggplot2)
library(readxl)
library(lubridate)
library(reshape2)
library(dplyr)

# misc.
base_path <- "C:/Users/mckyf/Northwestern University/Wells Research Group - CANDO+P Reactor/04 Performance data/" 
# data
file_path <- "In-cycle sampling"
excel_cycle <- "230330_gly_cycletest.xlsx"
excel_solids <- "daily_weekly_measurements.xlsx"
choose_date <- "2023-03-30"

df <- read_excel(file.path(base_path, file_path, excel_cycle))
solids <- get_recent_tss(file.path(base_path, excel_solids), choose_date)


# light parsing
df <- df %>% 
  mutate(hour = time_length(interval(min(time), time), "hour")) %>%
  select(-c(date, time)) %>%
  filter(phase %in% c("ana", "anx")) %>%
  melt(id = c("hour", "phase"))

title: March 30 2023 glycogen test
text:
Nutrient profile
Here is the phosphorus and nitrite profile over the sampling period. Note that the nitrate concentration was minimal so was excluded from this plot.


Code
## plotting params - phase labels and lines
ylim_custom <- round(max(df$value, na.rm = TRUE) + 10, 0)

# dynamic phase lines
phase_times <- df %>% group_by(phase) %>% summarise(t0 = min(hour))

phase_lines <- list(
  geom_vline(xintercept = filter(phase_times, phase == "anx")$t0, color="grey"))


phase_labs <- list(
  annotate("text", x = mean(phase_times$t0[1:2]), y = ylim_custom, label = "anaerobic"),
  annotate("text", x = mean(c(phase_times$t0[2], max(df$hour))), y = ylim_custom, label = "anoxic")
)


# pull colors and shapes
plot_list <- c("phosphate", "nitrite") # this has to be in order

plot_palette <- palette_df %>% filter(vars %in% plot_list)

custom_color <- scale_color_manual(name="Constituent",
                                   values=plot_palette$colors,
                                   labels=plot_palette$labels)

custom_shape <- scale_shape_manual(name="Constituent",
                                   values=plot_palette$shapes,
                                   labels=plot_palette$labels)

df %>% filter(variable %in% plot_list) %>%
  ggplot(data=.,aes(x=hour, y=value, color=variable, shape=variable)) +
  geom_point(size=2.5, alpha = 0.9) +
  custom_color +
  custom_shape +
  phase_lines +
  theme_defaults +
  phase_labs +
  labs(y="Concentration\n[mgP/L or mgN/L]", x="Hour") +
  ylim(0, ylim_custom)

title: March 30 2023 glycogen test
text:
Carbon profile
This is the COD profile over the same time period. Glucose was not added to this in=cycle test. Note that the glycogen concentration is reported as mg glucose as COD/g biomass. This profile does not follow the expected glycogen profile of PAO and GAO, where glycogen would be depleted in the anaerobic phase and replenished in the anoxic phase. I am going to try the measurement again this coming week with a few adjustments - the protocol I used this week can be found here.
Adjustments for Monday, April 3rd:

Add biomass into the digestion tube to produce a final digestion ratio of 1 mg biomass per 1 mL 0.9 M HCl. My ratio ended up being closer to 0.35 mg biomass per 1 mL 0.9 M HCl, so glycogen may not have been hydrolysed completely in all samples.
Take biomass samples from the aerobic phase. I only took samples from the anaerobic and anoxic phases to test the method with fewer samples, so I will add aerobic timepoints to better understand the complete glycogen profile.



Code
df_gly <- df %>% filter(variable == "glycogen")

# calculate mg glycogen/g biomass
df_gly$value <- df_gly$value * 3 / (solids$TSS * 0.015 / 0.010)

df_carbon <- rbind(df_gly, subset(df, variable == "propionate"))

ylim_custom <- 20 # have to manually mess with this with the dual y axis

phase_labs <- list(
  annotate("text", x = mean(phase_times$t0[1:2]), y = ylim_custom, label = "anaerobic"),
  annotate("text", x = mean(c(phase_times$t0[2], max(df$hour))), y = ylim_custom, label = "anoxic")
)

plot_list <- c("propionate", "glycogen")

plot_palette <- palette_df %>% filter(vars %in% plot_list)

custom_color <- scale_color_manual(name="Constituent",
                                   values=plot_palette$colors,
                                   labels=plot_palette$labels)

custom_shape <- scale_shape_manual(name="Constituent",
                                   values=plot_palette$shapes,
                                   labels=plot_palette$labels)


df_carbon %>% filter(variable %in% plot_list) %>%
    ggplot(data=., aes(x=hour, y=value, color = variable, shape = variable)) +
    geom_point(size=2.5) +
    phase_lines +
    phase_labs + 
    custom_color + 
    custom_shape + 
    theme_defaults +
    labs(y="COD concentration\n[mgCOD/L or mgCOD/gBiomass]", x="Hour")

title: March 30 2023 glycogen test
text:
P release rate
Based on the in-cycle plot, I will use the first 3 timepoints for this calculation.


Code
ana_phos_rate <- get_max_rate(df, "ana", "phosphate", 3, solids)


The maximum phosphate release rate is 10.84 mgP/gTSS/hour.

title: March 30 2023 glycogen test
text:
Denitrification rate & anoxic P uptake
Based on the in-cycle plot, I will use the first 4 timepoints for this calculation.


Code
anx_denit_rate <- get_max_rate(df, "anx", "nitrite", 4, solids)
anx_phos_rate <- get_max_rate(df, "anx", "phosphate", 4, solids)


The maximum denitrification rate is 3.22 mgN/gTSS/hour.
The maximum anoxic phosphorus uptake rate is 1.96 mgP/gTSS/hour.


Code
rates_df <- tibble(rates = c("phos_rel", "phos_up", "nit_denit"),
                   values = c(ana_phos_rate, anx_phos_rate, anx_denit_rate),
                   date = choose_date)

saveRDS(rates_df, file = here("data", paste0("rates-", choose_date, ".RDS")))

title: March 30 2023 glycogen test
text:
Denitrification rate


Code

title: March 30 2023 glycogen test
text:
P release and uptake rates


Code
ana_phos_rate <- get_max_rate(df, "ana", "phosphate", 3, solids)
anx_phos_rate <- get_max_rate(df, "anx", "phosphate", 4, solids)


The maximum phosphate release rate is 10.84 mgP/gTSS/hour.
The maximum anoxic phosphorus uptake rate is 1.96 mgP/gTSS/hour.

title: March 30 2023 glycogen test
text:
Carbon uptake rates


Code
ana_prop_rate <- get_max_rate(df, "ana", "propionate", 3, solids)


The maximum propionate uptake rate is 15.25 mgCOD/gTSS/hour.


Code
rates_df <- tibble(rate = c("ana_phos", "anx_phos", "aer_phos", "anx_denit", "ana_prop", "ana_glu"),
                   value = c(ana_phos_rate, anx_phos_rate, NA, anx_denit_rate, ana_prop_rate, NA),
                   )


# also save some important info - starting COD, N, P
rates_df <- append_rates_df(rates_df, df, choose_date)# specifying here since glycogen is listed as glucose for plotting purposes, maybe retool this later

saveRDS(rates_df, file = here("data", paste0("rates-", choose_date, ".RDS")))

title: March 23 2023
text:
Denitrification rate


Code
anx_denit_rate <- get_max_rate(df, "anx", "nitrite", 4, solids)


The maximum denitrification rate is 4.2 mgN/gTSS/hour.

title: March 23 2023
text:
P release and uptake rates


Code
ana_phos_rate <- get_max_rate(df, "ana", "phosphate", 3, solids)
anx_phos_rate <- get_max_rate(df, "anx", "phosphate", 4, solids)
aer_phos_rate <- get_max_rate(df, "aer", "phosphate", 3, solids)


The maximum phosphate release rate is 8.64 mgP/gTSS/hour.
The maximum anoxic phosphorus uptake rate is 1.75 mgP/gTSS/hour.
The maximum aerobic phosphorus uptake rate is 1.95 mgP/gTSS/hour.

title: March 23 2023
text:
Carbon uptake rates


Code
ana_prop_rate <- get_max_rate(df, "ana", "propionate", 3, solids)
ana_glu_rate <- get_max_rate(df, "ana", "glucose", 2, solids)


The maximum propionate uptake rate is 32.34 mgCOD/gTSS/hour. The maximum glucose uptake rate is 64.99 mgCOD/gTSS/hour.


Code
rates_df <- tibble(rate = c("ana_phos", "anx_phos", "aer_phos", "anx_denit", "ana_prop", "ana_glu"),
                   value = c(ana_phos_rate, anx_phos_rate, aer_phos_rate, anx_denit_rate, ana_prop_rate, ana_glu_rate),
                   )

# also save some important info - starting COD, N, P
rates_df <- append_rates_df(rates_df, df, choose_date)

saveRDS(rates_df, file = here("data", paste0("rates-", choose_date, ".RDS")))

title: March 13 2023
text:
Denitrification rate


Code
anx_denit_rate <- get_max_rate(df, "anx", "nitrite", 3, solids)


The maximum denitrification rate is 5.67 mgN/gTSS/hour.

title: March 13 2023
text:
P release and uptake rates


Code
ana_phos_rate <- get_max_rate(df, "ana", "phosphate", 3, solids)
anx_phos_rate <- get_max_rate(df, "anx", "phosphate", 3, solids)
aer_phos_rate <- get_max_rate_custom_range(df, "aer", "phosphate", 2, 4, solids)


The maximum phosphate release rate is 32.83 mgP/gTSS/hour.
The maximum anoxic phosphorus uptake rate is 3.83 mgP/gTSS/hour.
The maximum aerobic phosphorus uptake rate is 4.96 mgP/gTSS/hour.

title: March 13 2023
text:
Carbon uptake rates


Code
ana_prop_rate <- get_max_rate(df, "ana", "propionate", 5, solids)
ana_glu_rate <- get_max_rate(df, "ana", "glucose", 4, solids)


The maximum propionate uptake rate is 28.47 mgCOD/gTSS/hour. The maximum glucose uptake rate is 30.78 mgCOD/gTSS/hour.


Code
rates_df <- tibble(rate = c("ana_phos", "anx_phos", "aer_phos", "anx_denit", "ana_prop", "ana_glu"),
                   value = c(ana_phos_rate, anx_phos_rate, aer_phos_rate, anx_denit_rate, ana_prop_rate, ana_glu_rate),
                   )

# also save some important info - starting COD, N, P
rates_df <- append_rates_df(rates_df, df, choose_date)

saveRDS(rates_df, file = here("data", paste0("rates-", choose_date, ".RDS")))

title: Rate analysis
text:
Code
options(scipen = 0, digits = 2)
library(here)

# functions
source(here("scripts", "plotting.R"))

# packages
library(MetBrewer)
library(ggplot2)
library(lubridate)
library(dplyr)
library(purrr)

# data read in
df <- list.files(here("data"), pattern = ".RDS", full.names = TRUE) %>%
  map_dfr(readRDS) %>%
  relocate(date)

df$cod <- rowSums(df[,c("glucose", "propionate")], na.rm = TRUE)
df$cod_n <- df$cod / df$nitrite
df$cod_p <- df$cod / df$phosphate

title: Feburary 20 2023
text:

The maximum phosphate release rate is 2.61 mgP/gTSS/hour.

Code
ana_prop_rate <- get_max_rate(df, "ana", "propionate", 2, solids)


The maximum propionate uptake rate is 32.75 mgCOD/gTSS/hour.


Code
rates_df <- tibble(rate = c("ana_phos", "anx_phos", "aer_phos", "anx_denit", "ana_prop"),
                   value = c(ana_phos_rate, anx_phos_rate, aer_phos_rate, anx_denit_rate, ana_prop_rate),
                   )

# also save some important info - starting COD, N, P
rates_df <- append_rates_df(rates_df, df, choose_date)

saveRDS(rates_df, file = here("data", paste0("rates-", choose_date, ".RDS")))

title: Rate analysis
text:
P release and uptake rates


Code
df %>% filter(rate == "ana_phos") %>% 
  ggplot(data = ., aes(x = cod, y = value)) +
    geom_point(size = 2) +
    theme_defaults +
    labs(x = "COD [mg/L]", y = "P release rate [mgP/gVSS/hr]", title = "P release rates")







Code
phos_rates <- c("anx_phos", "aer_phos")

df %>% filter(rate %in% phos_rates) %>% mutate(rate = factor(rate, levels = phos_rates)) %>%
  ggplot(data = ., aes(x = cod, y = value, color = rate, shape = rate)) +
    geom_point(size = 2, alpha = 0.8) +
    scale_color_manual(values = met.brewer("Java", 2)) + 
    theme_defaults +
    labs(x = "COD [mg/L]", y = "P uptake rate [mgP/gVSS/hr]", title = "P uptake rates")





Code
df %>% filter(rate %in% phos_rates) %>% mutate(rate = factor(rate, levels = phos_rates)) %>%
  ggplot(data = ., aes(x = nitrite, y = value, color = rate, shape = rate)) +
    geom_point(size = 2, alpha = 0.8) +
    scale_color_manual(values = met.brewer("Java", 2)) + 
    theme_defaults +
    labs(x = "Influent NO2 [mgN/L]", y = "P uptake rate [mgP/gVSS/hr]", title = "P uptake rates")

title: Rate analysis
text:
Denitrification rates


Code
df %>% filter(rate == "anx_denit") %>%
  ggplot(data = ., aes(x = cod, y = value)) +
    geom_point(size = 2) +
    theme_defaults +
    labs(x = "COD [mg/L]", y = "Denitrification rate [mgN/gVSS/hr]", title = "Denitrification rate [NO2]")





Code
df %>% filter(rate == "anx_denit") %>%
  ggplot(data = ., aes(x = cod_n, y = value)) +
    geom_point(size = 2) +
    theme_defaults +
    labs(x = "COD:N ratio", y = "Denitrification rate [mgN/gVSS/hr]", title = "Denitrification rate [NO2]")

title: April 4 2023
text:
This week I performed in-cycle sampling with glycogen analysis following up last weeks test run. The changes I made were increasing the number of samples taken for glycogen analysis and optimizing the glycogen extraction step for better glycogen recovery. The results this week look much better and follow an expected pattern of glycogen use and storage.
Note that I am still waiting to hear back about an N2O sensor head replacement - I have no idea if the order has been placed or when its supposed to arrive.

title: April 4 2023
text:
Notebook set up


Code
### choose date 
choose_date <- "2023-04-04" 

options(scipen = 0, digits = 2)
library(here)

# functions
source(here("scripts", "cycle_parsing.R"))
source(here("scripts", "pull_solids.R"))
source(here("scripts", "plotting.R"))
source(here("scripts", "max_rates.R"))

# packages
library(MetBrewer)
library(ggplot2)
library(readxl)
library(lubridate)
library(reshape2)
library(dplyr)

# data
file_path <- "C:/Users/mckyf/Northwestern University/Wells Research Group - CANDO+P Reactor/04 Performance data/"
excel_cycle <- "cycle_results_2023.xlsx"
excel_solids <- "daily_weekly_measurements.xlsx"


df <- cycle_parse(file.path(file_path, excel_cycle), choose_date)
solids <- get_recent_tss(file.path(file_path, excel_solids), choose_date)




Code
df <- df %>% 
  mutate(value = ifelse(variable == "glycogen", 
                        value * (3 + 0.3 + 0.5) / (filter(solids, sample == "ml")$TSS * 5), 
                        value))

title: April 4 2023
text:
In-cycle plot with all data


Code
ylim_custom <- round(max(df$value, na.rm = TRUE) + 10, 0) # customize after looking at the plot

# dynamic phase lines
phase_times <- df %>% group_by(phase) %>% summarise(t0 = min(hour))

phase_lines <- list(
  geom_vline(xintercept = filter(phase_times, phase == "anx")$t0, color="grey"),
  geom_vline(xintercept = filter(phase_times, phase == "aer")$t0, color="grey"))


phase_labs <- list(
  annotate("text", x = mean(phase_times$t0[1:2]), y = ylim_custom, label = "anaerobic"),
  annotate("text", x = mean(phase_times$t0[2:3]), y = ylim_custom, label = "anoxic"),
  annotate("text", x = mean(c(phase_times$t0[3], max(df$hour))), y = ylim_custom, label = "aerobic")
)

# pull colors and shapes
plot_list <- c("phosphate", "nitrite", "propionate", "glucose", "glycogen") # this has to be in order

plot_palette <- palette_df %>% filter(vars %in% plot_list)

custom_color <- scale_color_manual(name="Constituent",
                                   values=plot_palette$colors,
                                   labels=plot_palette$labels)

custom_shape <- scale_shape_manual(name="Constituent",
                                   values=plot_palette$shapes,
                                   labels=plot_palette$labels)


df %>% filter(variable %in% plot_list) %>%
  ggplot(data=.,aes(x=hour, y=value, color=variable, shape=variable)) +
  geom_point(size=2.5, alpha = 0.9) +
  custom_color +
  custom_shape +
  phase_lines +
  theme_defaults +
  phase_labs +
  labs(y="Concentration\n[mgP/L, mgN/L, mgCOD/L,\nmgGlycogen/gBiomass]", x="Hour") +
  ylim(0, ylim_custom)

title: April 4 2023
text:
Carbon-only plot
Lets take a closer look at the carbon.


Code
ylim_custom <- round(max((filter(df, variable %in% c("propionate", "glucose", "glycogen"))$value), na.rm = TRUE) + 10, 0) # customize after looking at the plot

# dynamic phase lines

phase_labs <- list(
  annotate("text", x = mean(phase_times$t0[1:2]), y = ylim_custom, label = "anaerobic"),
  annotate("text", x = mean(phase_times$t0[2:3]), y = ylim_custom, label = "anoxic"),
  annotate("text", x = mean(c(phase_times$t0[3], max(df$hour))), y = ylim_custom, label = "aerobic")
)

# pull colors and shapes

plot_palette <- palette_df %>% filter(vars %in% plot_list)

                                   values=plot_palette$colors,

                                   labels=plot_palette$labels)

df %>% filter(variable %in% plot_list) %>%

  phase_lines +
  theme_defaults +
  phase_labs +

  ylim(0, ylim_custom)

title: April 4 2023
text:
Denitrification rate
The denitrification rate was steady over the entire anoxic period, and nitrite was mostly depleted by the end of the phase.


Code
anx_denit_rate <- get_max_rate(df, "anx", "nitrite", 4, solids)


The maximum denitrification rate is 2.79 mgN/gTSS/hour.

title: April 4 2023
text:
P release and uptake rates
The P release rate was rapid during the anaerobic phase, corresponding with a very quick glucose and propionate uptake rate. The P uptake was steady over both the anoxic and aerobic phases.


Code
ana_phos_rate <- get_max_rate(df, "ana", "phosphate", 3, solids)
anx_phos_rate <- get_max_rate(df, "aer", "phosphate", 6, solids)
aer_phos_rate <- get_max_rate(df, "aer", "phosphate", 4, solids)


The maximum phosphate release rate is 13.72 mgP/gTSS/hour.
The maximum anoxic phosphorus uptake rate is 0.53 mgP/gTSS/hour.
The maximum aerobic phosphorus uptake rate is 0.53 mgP/gTSS/hour.

title: April 4 2023
text:
Carbon uptake rates


Code
ana_prop_rate <- get_max_rate(df, "ana", "propionate", 3, solids)
ana_glu_rate <- get_max_rate(df, "ana", "glucose", 2, solids)


The maximum propionate uptake rate is 19.74 mgCOD/gTSS/hour.
The maximum glucose uptake rate is 18.21 mgCOD/gTSS/hour.


Code
rates_df <- tibble(rate = c("ana_phos", "anx_phos", "aer_phos", "anx_denit", "ana_prop"),
                   value = c(ana_phos_rate, anx_phos_rate, aer_phos_rate, anx_denit_rate, ana_prop_rate),
                   )

# also save some important info - starting COD, N, P
rates_df <- append_rates_df(rates_df, df, choose_date)

saveRDS(rates_df, file = here("data", paste0("rates-", choose_date, ".RDS")))

title: April 4 2023
text:
All data
A few observations:

The COD is consumed rapidly during the anaerobic phase, within about 15 minutes of starting the cycle test
I technically dosed 40 mgCOD/L each of propionate and glucose but this isnt reflected in the measurements, possible due to incomplete mixing at the beginning of the test or rapid COD uptake.
Not quite complete denitrification, but the influent COD:N was quite low (theoretically should have been 2:1).



Code
ylim_custom <- round(max(df$value, na.rm = TRUE) + 10, 0)

# dynamic phase lines
phase_times <- df %>% group_by(phase) %>% summarise(t0 = min(hour))

phase_lines <- list(
  geom_vline(xintercept = filter(phase_times, phase == "anx")$t0, color="grey"),
  geom_vline(xintercept = filter(phase_times, phase == "aer")$t0, color="grey"))


phase_labs <- list(
  annotate("text", x = mean(phase_times$t0[1:2]), y = ylim_custom, label = "anaerobic"),
  annotate("text", x = mean(phase_times$t0[2:3]), y = ylim_custom, label = "anoxic"),
  annotate("text", x = mean(c(phase_times$t0[3], max(df$hour))), y = ylim_custom, label = "aerobic")
)

# pull colors and shapes
plot_list <- c("phosphate", "nitrite", "propionate", "glucose", "glycogen") # this has to be in order

plot_palette <- palette_df %>% filter(vars %in% plot_list)

custom_color <- scale_color_manual(name="Constituent",
                                   values=plot_palette$colors,
                                   labels=plot_palette$labels)

custom_shape <- scale_shape_manual(name="Constituent",
                                   values=plot_palette$shapes,
                                   labels=plot_palette$labels)


df %>% filter(variable %in% plot_list) %>%
  ggplot(data=.,aes(x=hour, y=value, color=variable, shape=variable)) +
  geom_point(size=2.5, alpha = 0.9) +
  custom_color +
  custom_shape +
  phase_lines +
  theme_defaults +
  phase_labs +
  labs(y="Concentration\n[mgP/L, mgN/L, mgCOD/L or mgGlycogen/gBiomass]", x="Hour") +
  ylim(0, ylim_custom)

title: April 4 2023
text:
Glycogen profile
Lets take a closer look at the glycogen profile. The glycogen profile is interesting - intracellular glycogen seems to increase slightly during the anaerobic phase, then decrease by the end of the phase. I think the increase in glycogen during the anaerobic phase could be attributed to the glucose from the influent feed. Glycogen seems to be replenished during the anoxic and aerobic phases, which is expected behavior for a PAO/GAO culture.


Code
ylim_custom <- 10

# dynamic phase lines

phase_labs <- list(
  annotate("text", x = mean(phase_times$t0[1:2]), y = ylim_custom, label = "anaerobic"),
  annotate("text", x = mean(phase_times$t0[2:3]), y = ylim_custom, label = "anoxic"),
  annotate("text", x = mean(c(phase_times$t0[3], max(df$hour))), y = ylim_custom, label = "aerobic")
)

# pull colors and shapes
plot_list <- c("glycogen") # this has to be in order

plot_palette <- palette_df %>% filter(vars %in% plot_list)

custom_color <- scale_color_manual(name="Constituent",
                                   values=plot_palette$colors,
                                   labels=plot_palette$labels)

custom_shape <- scale_shape_manual(name="Constituent",
                                   values=plot_palette$shapes,
                                   labels=plot_palette$labels)

df %>% filter(variable %in% plot_list) %>%
  ggplot(data=.,aes(x=hour, y=value, color=variable, shape=variable)) +
  geom_point(size=2.5, alpha = 0.9) +
  custom_color +
  custom_shape +
  phase_lines + 
  phase_labs + 
  theme_defaults + 
  ylim(3, ylim_custom) + 
  labs(y="Concentration\n[mgGlycogen/gBiomass]", x="Hour")

title: Glycogen method 3/30/23
text:
Collect 15 mL of biomass at designated timepoints and fix at 4C for at least 2 hours


Prepare 15 mL tubes beforehand with 5 drops of 37% paraformaldehyde (used plastic dropper)
Put in walk in fridge for at least 2 hours per sample


Decant excess formaldehyde liquid


Centrifuge for 10 minutes at 5000 rpm
Decant, then add 10 mL of DI to each tube
Mix up biomass and DI water with cell spreader
Save the remaining biomass for storage (centrifuge again and decant, then store in -20C freezer)


Prepare digestion tubes


Pipette 1 mL of mixed biomass + DI into glass vials
Pipette 2 mL of 0.9 M HCl into each vial
Also prepare a blank with 1 mL DI + 2 mL HCl (same DI used for washing)


Digest at 100C for 2 hours
Cool in ice bath, then add 0.1 mL of 9 M NaOH to each tube to balance pH
Prepare for glucose measurement via Sigma glucose absorbance kit


Measure glucose concentration at 340 nm with 80 uL reagent, 30 uL sample

title: PHA stain method 4/13/23
text:
Collect 5 mL of biomass at designated timepoints and fix at 4C for at least 2 hours


Prepare 5 mL tubes beforehand with 0.5 mL of 37% paraformaldehyde in each
Put in walk in fridge for at least 2 hours per sample, can be left overnight

Note that this is the same procedure as biomass fixation for glycogen


Decant excess formaldehyde liquid and set aside sample for staining


Centrifuge for 10 minutes at 5000 rpm
Decant, then add 5 mL of DI to each tube
Resuspend pellet and aliquot 0.5 mL of mixture into an eppendorf tube


Prepare Nile Blue A staining solution - 0.02% w/v in ethanol
Add 0.5 mL staining solution to each eppendorf
Stain for 3 minutes at room temperature, then dispense into plate (200 uL) and read at excitation 360 and emission 460.
